tickerText: OpenClaw 2.0 released with improved agent orchestration ── Ollama adds DeepSeek-R1 support ── Claude Code now supports multi-file refactoring ── New AI funding round reaches $5.2B this week ── GitHub Copilot Chat integrates with VS Code terminal ── OpenClaw 2.0 released with improved agent orchestration

hero.headline: Complete OpenClaw Setup Guide: From Zero to Production in 30 Minutes
hero.deck: A comprehensive step-by-step tutorial covering secure deployment on AWS EC2, Docker configuration, Google Workspace integration, and personalized bot memory setup. Includes critical warnings about Tailscale configuration and HTTP blocking issues.
hero.author: Peter Yang (@petergyang)

sidebar.headline: Run AI Models Locally with Ollama + VSCode: Complete Setup in 5 Steps
sidebar.summary: Private AI coding without OpenAI API. Install Ollama, pull deepseek-coder:6.7b, configure Cline/Roo Code extension, and start coding with local models.

sidebar.headline: Effective Claude Code Workflow: Opus for Planning, Sonnet for Implementation
sidebar.summary: Battle-tested strategy from multiple developers: use Opus 4.5 for architectural decisions, then Shift+Tab to Sonnet for faster implementation.

sidebar.headline: Simon Willison Adds Function Calling to LLM CLI Tool
sidebar.summary: LLM command-line tool now supports tool calling across OpenAI, Anthropic, Gemini, and Ollama. Define tools as Python functions or bundle in plugins.

middle.headline: Building Mission Control: 10 AI Agents Working Together as a Real Team
middle.summary: Developer shares complete system architecture where specialized OpenClaw agents collaborate on complex tasks, demonstrating practical multi-agent orchestration patterns.
middle.author: Bhanu (@ayushtweetshere)

middle.headline: Claude Code + Ollama Integration: Run Local Models in 5 Minutes
middle.summary: Step-by-step guide to connect Claude Code with Ollama, llama.cpp, or cheaper alternatives like Kimi, MiniMax, and OpenRouter. Includes full configuration walkthrough.
middle.author: Luong Nguyen (@luongnv89)

middle.headline: OpenClaw Security Best Practices: Sandbox, Whitelist, and Audit Commands
middle.summary: Peter Steinberger outlines critical guardrails: enable sandbox, configure whitelist for external commands, use best prompt-injection defense models, and run security audits.
middle.author: Peter Steinberger (@steipete)

briefs.headline: DeepSeek-R1 Available on Ollama
briefs.text: 1.5B and 7B parameter models run on standard desktop PCs. Simple command: ollama run deepseek-r1

briefs.headline: Langflow Adds Qwen 2.5 for Local Tool Calling
briefs.text: Privacy-focused AI with local model hosting, agent setup, and tool integration via Ollama.

briefs.headline: sprites.dev Gaining Traction for OpenClaw Development
briefs.text: Developer-friendly platform optimized for running and deploying OpenClaw instances.

briefs.headline: MCP Protocol Adoption Accelerates
briefs.text: Anthropic's Model Context Protocol sees rapid enterprise adoption for seamless AI-tool integration.

opinions.author: Josh Pigford (@Shpigford)
opinions.headline: OpenClaw is Building Blocks: Your Brain Assembles Them
opinions.excerpt: People keep asking "what are you doing with it?" but that misses the point. OpenClaw's power is flexibility. The question isn't what it does—it's what you can imagine assembling from the pieces.

opinions.author: Patrick Mineault (@patrickmineault)
opinions.headline: Claude Code for Scientists: Separate Data Processing from Visualization
opinions.excerpt: Critical tip: use pure Python/R for data processing, keeping visualization code separate. Don't let AI write mixed processing+graphing code. This dramatically improves reliability and iteration speed.
